title: How do the police track location via phone number or IMEI ...
description: Apr 30, 2016   When your phone is on, police can track you through triangulation, as mentioned in one of the other answers. Again, you're connected to a tower and can be detected easily. Apart from this, police can get the documents you submitted while buying the SIM card and get your details from there. Also, android keeps a track of location history by default.

title: Can the police track your cell phone if it's turned off? - Quora
description: No they can't trace you if your phone is off. The only way for a Government agency or other Law enforcement agencies to track down your position if the phone is turned off, is for the phone to have been modified. They would have to change certain parameters of the OS. http://www.darkreading.com/risk-... The risk is extremely small.

title: Can Police find me by my mobile number? - Q&A - Avvo
description: Law enforcement can contact the telephone company and get the name of a person based on a phone number. Yes, they can track you down with your phone number. You are required to provide any new address to DMV. The police can obtain that information as well.

title: How you can help the Police recover your stolen smartphone ...
description: Dec 22, 2012   The very first thing you should do with your new phone is make a record of the IMEI (its also called an ICCID number or MEID number) number. This is a 16 digit number which is specific to your handset which the Police can use to track your phone, even if the thieves have changed the SIM card.
